BUILDING BLOCKS.Definition: the foundations, the pieces that something is built on

CEMENT.Definition: to make something such as an agreement or friendship stronger

DAY-TO-DAY.Definition: happening every day as a regular part of your job or life

DECEPTIVE.Definition: making you believe something that is not true

DON'T GET ME WRONG.Definition: said when you think someone might not understand what you say, or be upset by it

EITHER OR.Definition: used to refer to a situation in which there is a choice between two different plans of action, but both together are not possible

FIRE AWAY.Definition: used to tell someone they may begin asking questions

FLOW.Definition: a situation in which something is continuously moving, a state of concentration

FOR THAT MATTER.Definition: used to show that a statement is true in another situation, e.g. Ming's never been to Spain, or to any European country for that matter

IMMERSION.Definition: to become completely involved in something

INAUGURAL.Definition: an inaugural event is the first in a series of planned events

IPA.Definition: abbreviation for the International Phonetic Alphabet: a system of symbols for showing how words are pronounced

LAST RESORT.Definition: used for talking about something that you only think of doing or using if all other methods fail

LEXICON.Definition: (a list of) all the words used in a particular language or subject, or a dictionary

LONG STORY SHORT.Definition: used when you do not tell all the details

LONG TERM.Definition: continuing a long time into the future

ON ONE LEVEL.Definition: something that you say when you are speaking about two opposite ways of thinking about or reacting to a situation

ONGOING.Definition: continuing to exist or develop, or happening at the present moment

POLYGLOT.Definition: someone who can speak multiple languages

POLYGLOTS.Definition: someone who can speak multiple languages

SPELLED OUT.Definition: to explain the spelling letter by letter or to explain something in a very clear way with details

STUCK IN THEIR WAYS.Definition: completely unwilling to change one's ways of doing or thinking about things

SYNONYMS.Definition: a word or phrase that has the same or nearly the same meaning as another word or phrase in the same language

TAKE IT WITH A PINCH OF SALT.Definition: to not completely believe something that you are told

TARGET.Definition: the target language is the language you are learning

TIME-CONSUMING.Definition: something that takes a lot of time to do

TOOLKIT.Definition: a personal set of resources, abilities, or skills

TRICKY.Definition: If a piece of work or problem is tricky, it is difficult to deal with and needs careful attention or skill
